text: Climate Shift IndexDemonstrate immediate impacts by using the Climate Shift Index to put a number on the daily influence of climate change on local weather conditions.

Weather PowerCreate and download graphical forecasts of daily wind or solar electricity generation for any U.S. media market, county, or congressional district

Risk FinderExplore the risks of sea level rise and coastal flooding in any U.S. community with downloadable tables and figures, maps, local projections, and potential impacts to populations, land, property values, and more

Explore all Climate Matters materials in our resource library

Climate MattersIntroducing the Climate Shift IndexToday, in the spirit of #ShowYourStripes Day, Climate Central launches the Climate Shift Index—a science-based tool that now makes it possible to communicate the local influence of climate change, every day.

Climate MattersCoastal Wetlands at RiskOn World Oceans Day, a new Climate Central study explores how wetlands—and the benefits they provide to coastal communities, economies, and ecosystems—can, or cannot, adapt to rising sea levels.
Climate Matters2022 Summer PackageSummers are warming across the U.S. Since 1970, average summer temperatures have increased in 96% of 246 U.S. locations analyzed.

Climate MattersWestern Fire Weather Days IncreasingNew Climate Central analysis shows more frequent fire weather conditions across much of the western U.S. since 1973. Fire weather days have increased in all four seasons—especially spring and summer.

Climate MattersChanging Thunderstorm PotentialSevere weather accounts for nearly half of all billion-dollar weather disasters in the U.S. since 1980. How has one key indicator of thunderstorm severity—Convective Available Potential Energy (CAPE)—changed with recent warming?
Climate MattersPeak CO2 & Heat-trapping EmissionsHeat-trapping emissions have continued to increase—and atmospheric CO2 is on track to reach record-high concentrations this month.

Climate MattersWetter Rainfall Hours in a Warming ClimateNew analysis shows that hourly rainfall intensity—a key risk factor in flash floods—has increased since 1970 at 90% of 150 U.S. stations analyzed by Climate Central.
Climate MattersEarth Day: U.S. Warming RankingsAhead of Earth Day, we’re taking stock of widespread warming in 246 U.S. locations, 49 states, and the nation since 1970.

Climate MattersPollen Season & Climate ChangeClimate change is making pollen season longer and more intense, which could worsen health effects for millions of Americans with seasonal allergies and asthma.
